dct_title_s: Mako, Formosa (Taiwan), Boko-cho, Mako-Shicho. A.M.S. L991
dct_description_sm: Alternate title: Mako. In upper left margin: Formosa city plans 1:8,000. Polyconic projection. Relief shown by form lines and hachures. Compiled in 1945 form aerial photography dated July 1943 and July 1944 by photo-planimetric method and by reference to Formosa 1:25,000, A.M.S. Sheet 2017-IV SW, 1944; and Japanese Hydrographic Chart No. 235, 1932. Additional information from intelligence data. Place names are transcribed according to the modified Hepburn (Romaji) System. With a glossary. Name has been changed to Ma-kung [Makung]. Relief shown by form lines and hachures. "First edition (AMS 1), 1945. Type A (AMS 1), 1945." Military grid. Three classes of roads or trails, and areas of vegetation and cultivation are shown. Some buildings are named. Includes "Glossary." Marginal maps: Index to boundaries.--Coverage diagram. Place names are transcribed according to the modified Hepburn (Romaji) System. East Decimal Degree 119.583333. South Decimal Degree 23.550000. AMS 1. North Decimal Degree 23.566667. West Decimal Degree 119.550000.
dct_publisher_sm: Washington, D.C. : Army Map Service, U.S. Army, 1945.
